message.content:
I need to identify the line item in the cash flow statement that represents a decrease in amounts owed to the entity for goods or services sold on credit.

In accounting terms, amounts owed to a business for goods and services sold on credit are recorded as "Accounts Receivable." When accounts receivable decrease, it means customers are paying their outstanding balances, which represents a cash inflow. When accounts receivable increase, it means more sales are being made on credit than cash is being collected, which represents a cash outflow.

Looking at the cash flow statement, I can see a line item called "(Increase) Decrease in Accounts Receivable" with a value of "-335639.38". The negative sign indicates an increase in accounts receivable (more credit extended) rather than a decrease.

Since the task asks for the "decrease in amounts owed," I need to identify the line showing an increase in accounts receivable, which is precisely this line item. The value is -335639.38.

```json
{"solution": {'value': '-335639.38'}}
```
